doc.repnme: Quem vai abrir os furos de agua em Africa? Empresarios no subsector de abastecimento de agua rural
doc.abstracts: This document stresses that thousands of bore-holes are needed for the supply of water in Africa. These new holes will have a key role in increasing coverage of supply of water in many African countries, for such an amount of drilling is closely linked to effective fulfillment of its Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) objectives by 2015, with regard to the water supply. This study confronts this important issue. The foreign agencies tried to support capacity building drilling in governmental institutions and NGOs, but most admit today that that attempt failed, and are turning their attention to the private sector in search of solutions. However, it is not known how successful this approach was because most of the attempts were conducted in remote and inhospitable regions in the world, far from the eyes of donors and of government regulators. It is expected that the information from the four studies of the four pioneering companies will encourage the relevant players to develop stronger relationships with these bore-hole drillers and to provide them adequate support. The efficient implementation will attract more funding and support for the sector.
